Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with top of cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; above, possible floral motif in added white above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of foreleg and paw of feline to right; to the right, paw of feline to left; elaborate rosettes and rising triangle as filling ornament; below on cul, part of double guilloche band.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (on the evidence of being included in Petrie 1886, pl. V.)
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a light-walled and big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1). This heavy chalice is light-walled but large.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 261, no. 517, pl. 67)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1556) (phase 2)
